question: Is proteasome-dependent degradation of cyclin A2 during prometaphase required for the transition from unstable to stable kinetochoreâ€“microtubule attachments in mitosis? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: The switch to more stable k-MT attachments in metaphase requires the proteasome-dependent destruction of cyclin A in prometaphase.
content.source_2: Using high-resolution live-cell imaging and photoactivation-based turnover assays, we found that persistent cyclin A expression did not hinder the transition to stable k-MT attachments once chromosomes were aligned; attachment stability increased with normal kinetics despite elevated cyclin A.
content.source_3: Depletion of cyclin A2 by siRNA failed to promote premature k-MT stabilization; instead, kinetochore microtubules remained highly dynamic throughout prometaphase and only stabilized after APC/C activation.
